alert.note: Alert for Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; Southeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, South Lincoln County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 4:28PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Elbert and central Lincoln Counties through 515 PM MDT... At 428 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southeast of Simla, or 21 miles southwest of Limon, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kutch and Punkin Center. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; Southeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, South Lincoln County
